de.polygonal.ds.ArrayedStack

type
class
implements
Stack<T>
A dynamic arrayed stack. A stack is a linear list for which all insertions and deletions (and usually all accesses) are made at one end of the list.
This is called a LIFO structure (Last In, First Out).

Constructor

new(?maxSize : Int)
parameters
maxSize The maximum allowed size of the stack. The default value of -1 does not impose a size constraint.

Instance Methods

assign(x : Dynamic, ?args : Array<Dynamic>, ?limit : Int) : Void

parameters
x If x is a class reference, the stack is filled with instances of the specified class and the args parameter is used to pass additional constructor arguments. If x is an object or a primitive value, the object reference or the value of x is assigned instead.
limit If specified, the stack is filled with n=limit elements, otherwise the stack is filled from 0 to size(). Existing elements are preserved if limit < size().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError limit out of range (if debug flag is set).
Assigns new content to the stack by replacing elements with x.

clear() : Void

Removes all elements from this stack.
Call compact() afterwards to make all elements accessible for the garbage collector.

clone(assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError copier is null: element is not of type Cloneable (if debug flag is set).
Duplicates this stack.
If assign is true the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference. If assign is false and copier is null, the method assumes that all elements implement the Cloneable interface. In this case element.clone() is used for duplicating an element. Otherwise the method uses the copier function. The size of the duplicate is unbound (maxSize()=-1).

compact() : Void

To ensure the best possible performance, removing elements does not shrink the underlying container to the actual number of stored elements - they continue to exist even though they were removed. For that reason, calling compact() is needed to ensure that all removed elements can be garbage collected in the future.

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this stack contains the element x.

cpy(i : Int, j : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Stack is empty or index out of range or i equals j (if debug flag is set).
Overwrites the element at index i with the element from index j (zero indicates the bottommost element).

get(i : Int) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Stack is empty or index out of range (if debug flag is set).
Returns the element stored at index i (zero indicates the bottommost element).

isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this stack is empty.

iterator() : Iterator<T>

Iterates over all elements in this stack.

maxSize() : Int

The maximum allowed size of the stack. Once the maximum size is reached, pushing an element onto the stack will fail with an error (if debug flag is set). A value of -1 indicates that the size is unbound. Always returns -1 if debug flag is not set.

pop() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Stack is empty (if debug flag is set).
Pops data off the stack.

push(x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError size() equals maxSize() (if debug flag is set).
Pushes x onto the stack.

set(i : Int, x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Stack is empty or index out of range (if debug flag is set).
Stores x at the specified index i (zero indicates the bottommost element).

shuffle(?rval : Vector<Float>) : Void

parameters
rval A list of random double values in the range between 0 (inclusive) to 1 (exclusive).
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError rval is null or insufficient random values (if debug flag is set).
Shuffles the elements of this stack using the Fisher-Yates algorithm. If rval is not given, Math.random() is used, otherwise random values are taken from the specified rval array.

size() : Int

The total number of elements.

swp(i : Int, j : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Stack is empty or index out of range or i equals j (if debug flag is set).
Swaps the element stored at i with the element stored at j (zero indicates the bottommost element).

toArray(?output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

Pushes all elements to the output array ordered by the LIFO rule. The method creates a new array if output is not specified.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object. Prints out all elements if compiled with the -debug flag.
Example: 
	  var as = new de.polygonal.ds.ArrayedStack(4);
	  for (i in 0...4) as.push(i);
	  trace(as); //output:

	  {ArrayedStack, size/max: 4/4}
	  |< top
	    0 -> 3
	    1 -> 2
	    2 -> 1
	    3 -> 0
	  >|

toVector(?output : Vector<T>) : Vector<T>

Pushes all elements to the output vector ordered by the LIFO rule. The method creates a new vector if output is not specified.

top() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Stack is empty (if debug flag is set).
Returns the top element of the stack (the 'youngest' element).

walk(process : T -> Int -> T) : Void

Invokes the specified process function on each element. The function signature is: process(oldValue, index):newValue
